title: Interactive-sql
text:
HR sample data
Here we will use a sample Database called HR that manages the HR data of the small businesses which is collected from www.sqltutorial.org. And to create the database, a SQLite script file was used when rendering the document. Read the extension docs for details.

title: Interactive-sql
text:
ERD of HR database
The following database diagram illustrates the HR sample database:

Figure 1: ERD of HR database

title: Interactive-sql
Interactive-sql
text:
Not editable example
You can also create “not-editable” code chunk (that is, you simply can run the query but won’t be able to edit/modify it) for HR database. And to do this, just use another instance of database under the database key in the yaml with a different name and use the option editable: false.

title: Interactive-sql
text:
Not editable example

select * from employees;

title: SQL Course
text: SQL, or Structured Query Language, is a foundational tool for anyone interested in data science. With the exponential growth of data in today’s digital world, being able to efficiently query, manipulate, and analyze this data is essential. SQL is the standard language for relational database management systems and allows users to interact with databases in a straightforward and efficient manner. Knowledge of SQL enables data profiles to extract meaningful insights from large datasets, perform data analysis, and feed data into their machine learning models. Understanding SQL opens up opportunities in data analysis, data engineering, and beyond, making it a critical skill for any aspiring data profile.

title: SQL Course
text:
Chapters

Introduction to SQL and Databases - Overview of SQL, databases, and how they are used in data science.
Basic SQL Queries - Learning SELECT statements, filtering data with WHERE clauses.
Working with Multiple Tables - Introduction to JOIN operations and their importance.
Advanced Data Manipulation - Using GROUP BY, HAVING, and aggregate functions.
Subqueries and Nested Queries - Enhancing queries with subqueries for complex data retrieval.
Data Definition Language (DDL) - Understanding how to create and modify database structures.
Data Manipulation Language (DML) - Inserting, updating, and deleting data.
Transactions and Data Integrity - Managing transactions, understanding ACID properties.
Optimizing SQL Queries - Techniques for improving query performance.
Real-World SQL Projects - Applying learned skills to solve real-world data problems.

Each chapter is a step on your journey to mastering SQL. Let’s embark on this learning adventure together.
